intro: Pelargonium concinnum, commonly known as the Cape marigold, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bright yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual or biennial herb, reaching heights of up to 60 centimeters. Its leaves are palmately lobed and often have a hairy texture, while its stems are erect and branching. Pelargonium concinnum is valued for its ornamental appeal and is cultivated in gardens for its vibrant blooms.
